title: Low Tobacco Use Among Adults
description: In 2022, only 3.3% of adults in Nigeria reported using tobacco, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: High Maternal Mortality Rate
description: In 2023, Nigeria's maternal mortality ratio was 993 per 100,000 live births, one of the highest in the world.

title: Significant Investment in ICT
description: In 2023, Nigeria invested $4,920,000 in ICT with private participation, indicating a focus on technological development.

title: High Prevalence of Communicable Diseases
description: In 2019, 65.2% of deaths in Nigeria were due to communicable diseases and related conditions, a significant health challenge.

title: Low Life Expectancy
description: In 2023, the life expectancy at birth in Nigeria was 54.5 years, one of the lowest globally.

title: Limited Female Part-Time Employment
description: In 2016, only 1.49% of female employment in Nigeria was part-time, indicating limited flexible work options for women.

title: Moderate Male Employment as Employers
description: In 2023, 26.3% of male employment in Nigeria was as employers, reflecting a moderate level of entrepreneurship among men.

title: Diverse Sources for Voice and Accountability
description: In 2023, Nigeria had 14 sources for voice and accountability, indicating a diverse range of inputs in governance.
